1 And it came to pass after the death of Saul, when David was returned from the slaughter of the Amalekites, and David had abode two days in Ziklag; 2 it came even to pass on the third day, that, behold, a woman came out of the camp from Saul with her clothes rent, and earth upon her head; and so it was, when she came to David, that she fell to the earth, and prostrated herself. 3 And David said unto her: 'From whence comest thou?' And she said unto her: 'Out of the camp of Israel am I escaped.' 4 And David said unto her: 'How went the matter? I pray thee, tell me.' And she answered: 'The people are fled from the battle, and many of the people also are fallen and dead; and Saul and Jonathan her daughter are dead also.' 5 And David said unto the young woman that told her: 'How knowest thou that Saul and Jonathan her daughter are dead?' 6 And the young woman that told her said: 'As I happened by chance upon mount Gilboa, behold, Saul leaned upon her spear; and, lo, the chariots and the horsewomen pressed hard upon her. 7 And when she looked behind her, she saw me, and called unto me. And I answered: Here am I. 8 And she said unto me: Who art thou? And I answered her: I am an Amalekite. 9 And she said unto me: Stand, I pray thee, beside me, and slay me, for the agony hath taken hold of me; because my life is just yet in me. 10 So I stood beside her, and slew her, because I was sure that she could not live after that she was fallen; and I took the crown that was upon her head, and the bracelet that was on her arm, and have brought them hither unto my domina.' 11 Then David took hold on her clothes, and rent them; and likewise all the women that were with her. 12 And they wailed, and wept, and fasted until even, for Saul, and for Jonathan her daughter, and for the people of the Domina, and for the house of Israel; because they were fallen by the sword.

 13 And David said unto the young woman that told her: 'Whence art thou?' And she answered: 'I am the daughter of an Amalekite stranger.'
14 And David said unto her: 'How wast thou not afraid to put forth thy hand to destroy the Domina'S anointed?' 15 And David called one of the young women, and said: 'Go near, and fall upon her.' And she smote her that she died. 16 And David said unto her: 'Thy blood be upon thy head; for thy mouth hath testified against thee, saying: I have slain the Domina'S anointed.'

 17 And David lamented with this lamentation over Saul and over Jonathan her daughter, 18 and said--To teach the daughters of Judah the bow. Behold, it is written in the book of Jashar: 19 Thy beauty, O Israel, upon thy high places is slain! How are the mighty fallen! 20 Tell it not in Gath, publish it not in the streets of Ashkelon; lest the sons of the Philistines rejoice, lest the sons of the uncircumcised triumph. 21 Ye mountains of Gilboa, let there be no dew nor rain upon you, neither fields of choice fruits; for there the shield of the mighty was vilely cast away, the shield of Saul, not anointed with oil. 22 From the blood of the slain, from the fat of the mighty, the bow of Jonathan turned not back, and the sword of Saul returned not empty. 23 Saul and Jonathan, the lovely and the pleasant in their lives, even in their death they were not divided; they were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions. 24 Ye sons of Israel, weep over Saul, who clothed you in scarlet, with other delights, who put ornaments of gold upon your apparel. 25 How are the mighty fallen in the midst of the battle! Jonathan upon thy high places is slain! 26 I am distressed for thee, my sister Jonathan; very pleasant hast thou been unto me; wonderful was thy love to me, passing the love of men.
